column4: Is there a way to disable my internal webcam? I am trying to use zbarcam with an external manual focus webcam but it keeps activating the built in one.
you might be able to blacklist the module/driver for the webcam.. and hope the other webcam doesn't use the same module/driver
ok how would I determine which one it uses and how would I blacklist? grep comes to mind when identifing
lsmod will give you a list of modules in use.. you could use lsusb to check what the webcam identifies itself as
but it's probably one of 3 maybe 4 drivers.. there aren't that many
uvc something.., gspca, v4l .. those are the ones I can think of off the top of my head
here's a thread from ubuntuforums discussion turning off webcams http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291061
ah.. then it's using uvcvideo .. you can remove that by running    sudo modprobe -r uvcvideo
nope, it should work right away
and then you'll just have to hope that that other webcam doesn't use the same driver/module =)
well I mean did it unload it or not?
no error messages usually means it worked
you can check again with lsmod and see if it's gone
ah.. it's in use.. try removing the other modules listed next to uvcvideo in the lsmod output..
just ask your question.. I think there is a channel for bash as well.. ##bash or #bash perhaps?
